Class Graph

java.lang.Object
  Graph

public class Graph
extends java.lang.Object

This class is used to represent Graphs in the PURGES Evacuation Simulator. It is not general purpose and it is not designed as a general purpose representation. It is simply intended to be a theoretical representation of a 3D model in order to calculate movements for a person to make.

See Also:
Vertex

Method Detail

getRandomVertex

public Vertex getRandomVertex()
Return a pseudo random Vertex from the Graph. This is a shallow return, not a deep copy.

Returns:
The found random Vertex.

addVertex

public void addVertex(Vertex vin)
Add a Vertex to the current Graph. Adding the actual object, not a copy.

Parameters:
vin - The Vertex to add to the graph.

addEdge

public void addEdge(Vertex v1,
                    Vertex v2)
Connect two existing Vertices. They don't actually need to be in the Graph, so sensible use is assumed.

Parameters:
v1 - One of the Vertices on the new edge.
v2 - The second Vertex on the new edge.

dfTraverse

public java.util.ArrayList dfTraverse(Vertex vin)
Do a depth first traversal of the graph and return an ordered ArrayList of the traversal. The Vertices in the array list are the actual Vertex objects, not deep copies.

Parameters:
vin - The Vertex to start traversal from.
Returns:
An ordered ArrayList of the traversal.

astar

public java.util.ArrayList astar(Vertex sin,
                                 Vertex gin)
This is a the a* path finding algorithm. This uses an heuristic to get the near shortest path between two Vertices in the Graph. This method is strongly tied to the representation of the Vertex class. The returned list hold the actual Vertex objects, not a deep copy.

It should be noted that this may not necessarily return a path to the desired Vertex from the starting Vertex. If no path is found, this version of a* will return a path of erratic behaviour. This is trying to model what would happen in real life in a very basic way.

Parameters:
sin - The Vertex to start from.
gin - The Vertex to end up at.
Returns:
The ordered ArrayList of the path found by a*.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Return a String representation of this Graph. Depends partly on the toString method of the Vertex class.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
The human readable String representation of this Graph.
